name: Chase, Andy
title: Founder and Label Owner
notes: American musician, songwriter, and record producer best known as a founding member of the band Ivy alongside Adam Schlesinger and Dominique Durand. He co-owned Stratosphere Sound recording studio in NYC with James Iha and Adam Schlesinger, and has produced records for artists including the Smashing Pumpkins, Tahiti 80, and Fountains of Wayne.

name: Demmon, Roy Earl
title: Co-Founder
notes: Roy Earl Demmon (February 3, 1927 - March 8, 2012) was a California commercial real estate executive who co-founded Demmon-Hunter in 1960 and later Demmon Partners. He briefly served in the Reagan Administration in 1981 as Executive Assistant at HUD and Director of Operations and Marketing for the Federal Home Loan Board.
political_donations: Republican; served in the Reagan Administration and was a long-time supporter of the Republican Party.

name: Hubach, Richard Elmer
title: Founder
notes: Richard Alan Hubach earned a PhD in Physics from UC Berkeley. He worked at Rocketdyne and Hughes Research Laboratories (HRL) before founding View Engineering in 1977, a high-tech research and manufacturing company. He was remembered by colleagues as both a mentor and successful entrepreneur.

name: Hughes, Louis R.
title: Executive Advisor
notes: Louis R. Hughes (born February 10, 1949) is a former General Motors Executive Vice President who served from 1992-2000, responsible for GM International Operations and GM Europe, including the chairmanship of Adam Opel AG and Saab Automobile. He has served on boards of 12+ corporations in 7 countries including ABB, Alcatel-Lucent, Deutsche Bank, and British Telecom.

name: Inman, Bobby R.
employer: University of Texas at Austin, LBJ School of Public Affairs
title: Professor (LBJ Centennial Chair in National Policy)
notes: Admiral Bobby Ray Inman (born April 4, 1931) is a retired four-star U.S. Navy Admiral who served as Director of the National Security Agency (1977-1981) and Deputy Director of Central Intelligence. After military retirement he led MCC and Westmark Systems, then became a tenured professor at UT Austin's LBJ School in 2001. In 2024 he endorsed Kamala Harris for president.
political_donations: Endorsed Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris in 2024 despite long Republican-affiliated intelligence community background.

name: Jacobus, Jay William
employer: Law Office of Jay William Jacobus
title: Attorney
notes: Jay William Jacobus is a California attorney admitted to the bar in 1973 after attending Golden Gate University School of Law in San Francisco. He practices probate litigation in Walnut Creek, California, specializing in will and trust litigation, conservatorship, guardianship, and elder law litigation.

name: Keyston, Douglas A.
title: Financial Advisor
notes: Douglas Keyston is a Financial Advisor at Morgan Stanley Wealth Management in Menlo Park, California, specializing in private wealth management with over 20 years of experience. Prior to Morgan Stanley, he was a Credit Risk Executive and Managing Director at Bank of America's Specialized Industries Group, overseeing gaming, lodging, and sports industry sectors globally with approximately $10 billion in committed capital.

name: Lu, Li
title: Founder and Chairman
notes: Li Lu (born April 6, 1966) is a Chinese-born American value investor and philanthropist who founded Himalaya Capital in 1997. He was a student leader in the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests and later received three degrees simultaneously from Columbia University. Charlie Munger invested $88 million in his fund in 2004. He co-founded The Asian American Foundation in 2021 and served as its inaugural board chair through 2024.
ngos: The Asian American Foundation (co-founder and former board chair), CalTech Board of Trustees, Columbia University Board of Trustees (2017-2024), Committee of 100, Council on Foreign Relations, Aspen Institute Henry Crown Fellow

name: Mathews, Scott
title: Founder and CEO
notes: Scott Mathews (born July 25, 1955) is an American music producer, composer, arranger, and multi-instrumentalist based in Mill Valley, California. Over more than 40 years he has worked with artists ranging from Mick Jagger and Barbra Streisand to the Beach Boys, accumulating more than 40 million units in sales. He owns Tiki Town Studios and Hang On To Your Publishing Company.

name: McDermott, Edward Henry

name: Meacham, Jon
title: Rogers Chair in American Presidency; Canon Historian, Washington National Cathedral
notes: Jon Meacham (born May 20, 1969) is a Pulitzer Prize-winning historian and presidential biographer who won the 2009 Pulitzer for 'American Lion: Andrew Jackson in the White House.' He holds the Carolyn T. and Robert M. Rogers Endowed Chair in American Presidency at Vanderbilt University and was appointed Canon Historian of the Washington National Cathedral in 2021. He was a former editor-in-chief of Newsweek.
ngos: Thomas Jefferson Foundation (former trustee and chair), Smithsonian's National Museum of American History (trustee), The New-York Historical Society (trustee), Washington National Cathedral
political_donations: Democratic-leaning; helped write speeches for President Biden, spoke at the 2020 Democratic National Convention, and assisted Nancy Pelosi with her 2022 leadership transition announcement.

name: Murakami, Michael T.
title: Principal
notes: Michael T. Murakami, AIA, is a licensed architect and Principal at the architecture firm murakami/nelson, based in California. He holds a B.Arch from the University of California, Berkeley and is registered as an architect in California.

name: Oberndorf, William Edward
title: Founder and Managing Partner
notes: William Ernst Oberndorf is an American billionaire businessman and Republican political donor who graduated from Williams College (1975) and Stanford GSB (MBA 1978). He founded SPO Partners investment firm in 1989. He is a prominent advocate for school choice and co-founded the Alliance for School Choice (now American Federation for Children).
ngos: American Federation for Children (chairman), UCSF Foundation (trustee), California Academy of Sciences, Thacher School (trustee), University School Cleveland (trustee), Williams College (trustee), UCSF Board of Overseers (chairman)
political_donations: Major Republican donor; gave over $1 million to California Republican Party 2001-2011; supported Romney, Boehner, Graham; also donated to Democrats Dianne Feinstein and Harry Reid; refused to support Trump in 2016. OpenSecrets profile available.

name: Oliver, Gary Charles

name: Prezant, William A.
title: Senior Advisor
notes: William A. Prezant (born November 21, 1946) is an attorney with over 50 years of experience in health care law, trust litigation, business law, and administrative law. He is a partner at Prezant & Mollath and Senior Advisor to Blue Owl Capital. He served as Chairman of Strategic Hotels & Resorts (2007) and as a two-term appointee of Governor Gavin Newsom on the California State Teachers Retirement Board (CalSTRS) until July 2024.
ngos: California State Teachers Retirement System / CalSTRS (former board member, Newsom appointee)

name: Price, William Stanley III
employer: TPG Capital (Partner Emeritus); Common Sense Media (Chairman Emeritus)
title: Co-Founder and Partner Emeritus
notes: William S. 'Bill' Price III co-founded TPG Capital (originally Texas Pacific Group) in 1992 with David Bonderman and James Coulter. A Stanford undergrad and UC Berkeley law graduate, he previously worked at Gibson Dunn, Bain & Company, and GE Capital before co-founding TPG. He scaled back in 2006 to focus on wine vineyard investments and philanthropy.
ngos: Common Sense Media (chairman emeritus/board), Gladstone Institutes (Foundation Board Chair), California Academy of Sciences (board), California Mentor Foundation (board), Dignity Fund (board)
political_donations: Donated to Mitt Romney in 2007-2008; generally Republican-aligned but bipartisan on some causes.

name: Reppas, David L.
title: Senior Vice President - Wealth Management, Portfolio Manager
notes: David Lee Reppas, CFP, is a financial advisor at UBS Financial Services in Walnut Creek, California, leading the Sentinel Wealth Consulting Group with over 900 million dollars in assets under management. He has been in the financial services industry since 1987, previously at EF Hutton and Morgan Stanley, joining UBS in 2009.

name: Rosenblatt, Toby
employer: The Glen Ellen Company / Founders Investments Ltd.
title: President
notes: Toby Rosenblatt is a San Francisco-based private investor who is President of The Glen Ellen Company and Vice President of Founders Investments Ltd. He holds a B.A. from Yale and an MBA from Stanford. He served as President of the San Francisco City Planning Commission (1977-1988) and was the founding chair of the Presidio Trust, appointed by President Clinton.

name: Schmidt, Eric Clausen
title: Co-Founder (Schmidt Sciences); CEO (Relativity Space, since 2025)
notes: Eric Emerson Schmidt (born April 27, 1955) is former CEO of Google (2001-2011) and Executive Chairman of Alphabet (2011-2017). He co-founded Schmidt Sciences in 2024 and became CEO of Relativity Space in 2025. He chairs the Schmidt Family Foundation, Schmidt Ocean Institute, and SandboxAQ. His middle name is Emerson, not Clausen; the 'Clausen' in the member list may reflect a Bohemian Club internal identifier or a family connection.
ngos: Schmidt Family Foundation (co-founder), Schmidt Ocean Institute (co-founder), Schmidt Sciences (co-founder), Broad Institute (chair, board of trustees), Mayo Clinic (board), SandboxAQ (chairman), Berggruen Institute (board), Science for America (director), National Security Commission on AI (chair)
political_donations: Primarily Democratic donor; gave $224,000 in 2016 cycle, $8.5 million in 2020 cycle, and over $4 million in 2022 cycle. In-kind contributions worth $227,000 to 18 state Democratic parties in 2022 for tech/voter data. Considered funding AI tools to assist Democrats.

name: Schmoke, Kurt L
title: President
notes: Kurt Lidell Schmoke (born December 1, 1949) is the 47th Mayor of Baltimore (1987-1999), the first African American elected to that post. A Yale graduate, Rhodes Scholar, and Harvard Law graduate, he later served as Dean of Howard University School of Law (2003-2012) and has been President of the University of Baltimore since 2014. Named Vice Chair of Carnegie Corporation of New York in 2024.
ngos: Carnegie Corporation of New York (Vice Chair), Johns Hopkins University Press Advisory Board (member)
political_donations: Democratic-aligned; served in Carter Administration; known for bipartisan drug policy advocacy.

name: Srivastava, Deepak
title: President, Gladstone Institutes; Professor, UCSF
notes: Deepak Srivastava, MD, is a cardiovascular researcher and President of Gladstone Institutes (since 2018), also serving as the Younger Family Professor and Senior Investigator at the Gladstone Institute of Cardiovascular Disease. He is a UCSF professor and attending pediatric cardiologist at UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital. He co-founded iPierian Inc. and Tenaya Therapeutics.
ngos: International Society for Stem Cell Research (former president 2019-2020), American Academy of Arts and Sciences (member), National Academy of Medicine (member)

name: Stephens, Paul H.
title: Partner and Chairman
notes: Paul Stephens is a veteran West Coast investment manager who co-founded Robertson Stephens & Company in 1978 with Sandy Robertson and later launched the Contrarian Fund in 1993. He was co-founder and Chief Investment Officer of RS Investments (1998-2005), and later joined Stephens Investment Management (founded by his sons Bart and Brad) as Partner and Chairman.

name: Thirkell, Edward D.
title: Founder and Principal
notes: Edward Donald Thirkell is a California attorney and founder of Thirkell Law Group in San Mateo, California, specializing in trust litigation, estate planning, probate, and conservatorships. A UC Berkeley School of Law graduate (1966), he has been practicing law since 1970 and has been repeatedly selected to California Super Lawyers (2005-2026). He passed away in February 2026 according to an obituary filed at Legacy.com.

name: Thiry, Kent J.
title: Former Chairman and CEO; Co-Chair
notes: Kent Thiry served as CEO of DaVita from 1999 to 2019, growing it into a Fortune 250 dialysis company. A Stanford political science graduate and Harvard MBA, he was acquitted of federal antitrust charges in 2022 related to employee no-poach agreements. He stepped down as Executive Chair in June 2020 and now focuses on electoral reform and philanthropy.
ngos: The Nature Conservancy (global board), Unite America (co-chair and co-founder), Endeavor Colorado (founding board member), Colorado Thrives (founder and chair)
political_donations: Former Republican; donated to Romney and McCain. Since 2016 a registered independent who has spent over $13 million total on federal and state races with emphasis on nonpartisan election reform in Colorado.

name: Tierney, Thomas J.
title: Co-Founder and Co-Chairman
notes: Thomas J. Tierney (born March 5, 1954) co-founded The Bridgespan Group in 1999, a nonprofit consulting firm serving philanthropists and nonprofits. He previously served as CEO of Bain & Company (1992-2000). A UC Davis and Harvard Business School graduate, he is a prolific author in the philanthropy space.
ngos: The Nature Conservancy (former chair), Stanford Hoover Institution (former chair), Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (former director), eBay (former board chair), United Way of the Bay Area (former board), Catholic Charities, WGBH, The National Academies

name: Tjian, Robert
title: Professor of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology (Li Ka Shing Chancellor's Chair)
notes: Robert Tjian (born 1949 in Hong Kong) is a renowned biochemist at UC Berkeley who discovered transcription factors that control gene expression. He earned a BS from Berkeley (1971) and PhD from Harvard (1976). He served as President of the Howard Hughes Medical Institute (2009-2016) and is now scientific advisor to the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative and BioHub.
ngos: Howard Hughes Medical Institute (former president 2009-2016), Science Philanthropy Alliance (co-founder and former board member), Lasker Foundation (board), Chan Zuckerberg Initiative (scientific advisor), Amgen (scientific advisory board)
